definition: meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: That good for nothing never sends any money to his poor mother.
sentences.chinese: 那個沒用的傢伙，從不給他可憐的母親送錢。

sentences.english: Man is the only creature that consumes without producing.
sentences.chinese: 人是一種最可憐的傢伙，什麼都產不了，只會揮霍。

sentences.english: Hey fellas have you heard the news?
sentences.chinese: 嘿傢伙你聽到這個消息？

sentences.english: He always borrows money from others but the repayment is on the Greek calends .
sentences.chinese: 當心那傢伙，他總是找別人借錢，但是從不還錢。

sentences.english: Well,I suppose one possibility would be to say the guy in New York is Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 我猜其中一個可能性會是，紐約傢伙是拿破崙。

sentences.english: Sb. could fall into shit and come up smelling of roses !
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙運氣特別好，掉進糞坑裏還能揀個金元寶。

sentences.english: Forget it because these guys are usually in a rush.
sentences.chinese: 還是算了吧，這些傢伙通常匆匆忙忙。

sentences.english: This bloke was breaking the unwritten rules for men.
sentences.chinese: 這個傢伙打破了男人們應該遵守的不成文規則。

sentences.english: This guy looked like a beaten-up spider-monkey mutant.
sentences.chinese: 這個傢伙看起來活像個蓬頭垢面的蜘蛛猴變種人。

sentences.english: Surrounded by guardsoul the little guy can perish the old guy thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 被守護魄環繞着的小傢伙能徹底毀滅老傢伙。

sentences.english: Surrounded by guardsoul the little guy can perish the old guy thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 被守護魄環繞着的小傢伙能徹底毀滅老傢伙。

sentences.english: "I was at home taking care of the kids, " she says.
sentences.chinese: “那會兒我正在家裏照顧小傢伙們”，她說。

sentences.english: Battles between these mega carnivores must have been quite a spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 這些大傢伙之間的爭鬥場面肯定相當壯觀。

sentences.english: The only guy who was hard to get to know was Richie Gaspari.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的傢伙誰是很難了解的是裏奇斯帕裏。

sentences.english: Does it bother you if I stir it with my fingers, old-timer?
sentences.chinese: 介意我用指頭攪拌一下嗎，老傢伙？

definition: companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
